dc:title: Day After Day - November 1934
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Observations about the hardships of Mother Seton, the gift of thirty dozen eggs, the oppression of a steelworker, and an accident befalling three poor boys. Recommends nursery schools so mothers can work and not be separated from their children by the city. A book review of Calverton's The Passing of the Gods which is dismissed as "the shallowest book of the month."
